intro: Dasystephana lagodechiana, commonly known as the African bellflower, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while its stems are erect and branching. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, making it a notable ornamental plant in gardens.
